mentions.context: The Pytorch (Paszke et al., 2019) code for our top-K loss and experiments can be found at: https://github. com/garcinc/noised-topk.
The Pytorch (Paszke et al., 2019) code for our top-K loss and experiments can be found at: https://github. com/garcinc/noised-topk.

Indeed, for many real-world applications, a longtailed phenomenon appears (Reed, 2001): a few labels enjoy a lot of items (e.g., images), while the vast majority of the labels receive only a few items, see for instance a dataset like Pl@ntnet-300k (Garcin et al., 2021) for a more quantitative overview.
